reproducibility_rules: Commands must be recorded as exact `rch exec -- ...` invocations.
Coverage-attribution fields must cite concrete artifact path fragments (for example, `...json#field`).
Measurement windows are UTC-bounded and must not overlap.

dimension_contracts.outcome_question: Do proof-guided optimization envelopes improve hot-path behavior without conformance regressions?
Do theorem-assumption guardrails reduce unresolved reliability risk and speed triage?
Do proof-aware review gates and refinement contracts reduce correctness-regression risk?

performance_workloads.objective: Measure scheduler responsiveness under mixed ready/cancel load while keeping conformance green.
performance_workloads.repro_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test refinement_conformance refinement_semantics_trace_golden -- --nocapture

performance_workloads.objective: Measure cancellation and loser-drain stability in proof-constrained race paths.

metrics.confidence_note: Opportunity-map coverage moved from absent to complete for deterministic optimization envelopes.
Reliability hardening contract now covers all four assumption classes with deterministic triage flow and policy routing.
Proof-impact review workflow and runtime-state refinement contract are fully linked into executable workflow checks.

workload_results.confidence_note: Performance signal moved from no proof-guided envelope data to deterministic envelope + conformance-linked measurement contract.
workload_results.workload_definition: Mixed ready/cancel scheduler path constrained by lock-order and cancellation protocol anchors.

workload_results.confidence_note: Loser-drain path now has explicit proof-guided measurement and reproducible conformance command hooks.
workload_results.workload_definition: Cancellation/race loser-drain path measured through deterministic trace-equivalence checks.

attribution_notes: Workload deltas are explicitly tied to proof-guided optimization constraints from asupersync-2x0ha.
Numeric deltas are contract-completeness signals in this cycle; follow-up cycles should append throughput/latency observations with fixed workloads.

delta_summary.confidence_note: Reliability trend deltas indicate faster diagnosis and lower severity/frequency once assumption-class guardrails are fully covered.

attribution_method.description: Pair each reliability metric window with invariant/assumption coverage milestones and deterministic conformance checks before attributing deltas.
assumptions: Incident/failure samples are collected under comparable workload mix across windows.
Coverage milestones are sourced from canonical invariant artifact paths without ad-hoc remapping.

caveats: Current reliability deltas are deterministic governance-trend signals and should be supplemented with larger-window operational samples in follow-up cycles.
Severity index is weighted for relative comparison and is not a replacement for full incident postmortem narratives.

delta_summary.confidence_note: Correctness trend indicates fewer regressions and lower rework/diagnosis burden once proof-aware workflow gates and refinement conformance checks are fully linked.

governance_adjustments.trigger: Apply mandatory proof-impact declaration review when regression-per-100-changes trend stops improving.
Escalate to weekly proof-health review if rework-hours-per-regression rises above baseline-adjusted threshold.

caveats: Correctness trend metrics are short-window governance indicators and should be paired with longer-horizon release-cycle observations.
Regression and rework metrics are normalized for deterministic comparison and should be interpreted with workload context.

confidence_caveats: Current deltas represent contract-completeness outcomes and conformance readiness, not long-horizon production telemetry.
Follow-up beads asupersync-228pu, asupersync-2ue65, and asupersync-3o1ga must append workload/incident/query-derived values in future snapshots.

steps: Collect proof/invariant/refinement anchors and map them to target engineering surface.
Define bounded intervention with explicit non-negotiable constraints and acceptance checks.
Run deterministic baseline/current measurements with rch-offloaded reproducible commands.
Publish before/after deltas with caveats and update governance follow-ups.
checklists: Include theorem/invariant and refinement-map anchors for every intervention.
Include at least one conformance command proving no semantic regression.
Record bead lineage from proof artifact to intervention to measured impact.
Document confidence notes and residual risks before sign-off.
failure_modes: Missing artifact linkage between theorem anchors and code intervention.
Non-reproducible measurements caused by ad-hoc command/environment drift.
Governance updates omitted despite negative or ambiguous trend signals.

case_studies.baseline: No proof-guided workload envelope contract existed for scheduler/cancel hot paths.
case_studies.intervention: Introduced deterministic workload definitions and before/after delta evidence in Track-6 report under proof-guided constraints (asupersync-228pu).
case_studies.measured_outcome: Performance signal contract moved from baseline 0.0 to current 1.0 with explicit workload repro hooks and attribution.
repro_commands: rch exec -- cargo test --test refinement_conformance refinement_semantics_trace_golden -- --nocapture
residual_risks: Current cycle reflects deterministic governance signals and requires future throughput/latency augmentation.

case_studies.baseline: Reliability trends were not tied to invariant-assumption coverage milestones.
case_studies.intervention: Added reliability milestone series, delta summary, and attribution method tied to assumption-class hardening artifacts (asupersync-2ue65).
case_studies.measured_outcome: Diagnostic-time, incident-frequency, and severity-index trends show deterministic downward deltas aligned with full guardrail coverage.
residual_risks: Reliability trend windows should be expanded with larger operational sample sets in follow-up cycles.

case_studies.baseline: Proof/conformance gate maturity was not directly tied to regression and rework burden trends.
case_studies.intervention: Added correctness maturity snapshots, reproducible query hooks, and governance-adjustment policy triggers (asupersync-3o1ga).
case_studies.measured_outcome: Correctness trend shows reduced regression rate, reduced rework burden, and faster diagnosis under full gate maturity.
residual_risks: Correctness trend metrics are short-window indicators and require release-cycle longitudinal validation.
